definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: I don't like people who are too critical about everything.
sentences.chinese: 我没有喜爱对于每件事都太求全责备的人。

sentences.english: When he employs a person, he demands perfection.
sentences.chinese: 至于使用人的时候，他是求全责备的。

sentences.english: He does not demand perfection in one man.
sentences.chinese: 对一个人不要求全责备。

sentences.english: You will never be satisfied, unless you don't complain about anything.
sentences.chinese: 当你不求全责备时，你才会感到满足。

sentences.english: I so jellyfish, are completely hidden blame the heart of jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 我这么求全责备，完全是暗藏嫉妒之心。

sentences.english: Chinese politeness by no means forbids one to "look a gift horse in the mouth."
sentences.chinese: 中国的礼节并没有制止人们对礼物求全责备。

definition: see 求全責備|求全责备[qiu2 quan2 ze2 bei4]
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to look for bones in an egg/to find fault/to nitpick (idiom)
pinyin: ji1 dan4 li5 tiao1 gu3 tou5

definition: not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
